title: Product Opportunity
description: The first stage is for us to understand the needs of your company and the product you are keen to test, and for you to understand the mission and capabilities of the Living Lab team. This is followed by the signing of a non-disclosure agreement so that you can safely communicate details with us. The third stage is for us to understand in detail what your product does, its functional specifications and the environment in which it will be deployed. We will then form a joint team to work on developing the test procedures. This is done in a collaborative on-line environment enabling ease of communication between team members. Once drafted the test procedures are approved and executed. Results are rapidly shared with the team members. A final report is co-drafted by the team.

requirements.title: Test Checklist
requirements.content:
It is essential that an understanding of the functional requirements and operating conditions are known prior to designing an accelerated life test. A Failure Modes and Effects Analysis may need to be developed prior to or in conjunction with the accelerated life testing development.
  • Product functional specification documentation
  • General technical specification required by your future potential customers
  • Failure Modes and Effects Analysis(FMEA) (or similar product risk assessment process)
  • Instructions for installation, troubleshooting, resetting and removal
  • Contact instructions and processes

title: Function and Safety Standards
description: Your functional requirements and anticipated operating conditions will determine the nature of the accelerated life tests to be conducted. Where you have Standards you need to meet, we ask you to share these with us, and we can also access Australian and International Standards. There are several standards for testing such as vibration, UV and ingress protection standards that are referenced by companies throughout Australia. For ease of access we have made some of these available here.

requirements.title: Examples of ALT Standards
requirements.content:
• Occupational Safety and Health Act 1984 (WA) and Occupational Safety and Health Regulations 1996 (WA)
  • AS60529 Degrees of Protection provided by enclosures (IP Code)
  • ISO 4892-1 Plastics - Methods of exposure to laboratory light sources - Part 1: General guidance
  • ISO 4892-2 Plastics - Methods of exposure to laboratory light sources - Part 2: Xenon-arc lamps
  • MIL-STD-810H Environmental considerations and laboratory tests
  • I.S. EN IEC 61000-6-2:2019 Electromagnetic Compatibility (emc) - Part 6-2: Generic Standards - Immunity Standard for Industrial Environments
  • I.S. EN IEC 61000-6-4:2019 Electromagnetic Compatibility (emc) - Part 6-4: Generic Standards - Emission Standard for Industrial Environments
  • ISO 16750:2018 Road vehicles
  • AS 60068.2.78-2003 Environmental testing Part 2.78: Tests-Test Cab: Damp heat, steady state
  • AS 60068.2.2-2003 Environmental Testing Part 2.2: Tests-Tests B: Dry heat
  • AS 60068.2.1-2003 Environmental Testing Part 2.1: Tests-Tests A: Cold

title: Accelerated Life Test Trial Proposal
description: This document is co-developed by the team which includes representative from the company and the Living Lab team. Broadly the main sections are as follows

requirements.title: Structure
requirements.content:
1. Overview of the intent of the trials
  2. Section for each type of trial (UV, IP, etc)
    • Function being tested
    • Non-accelerated time period and operating conditions
    • Test options
      • Equipment
      • Test conditions and time, supporting calculations
      • Relevant Standards
      • Costs (for consumables)
    • Comparison of test options
    • Detailed test description
      • Aims/ hypothesis
      • Test method
      • Equipment required
      • Procedure
      • Results
    • Risk and safety assessment
